thread.title: FOOTBALL: Northern scores game-winning TD to lead Jeffersonville past New Albany
thread.title_full: FOOTBALL: Northern scores game-winning TD to lead Jeffersonville past New Albany

author: kevin.harris@newsandtribune.com(Kevin Harris)
title: FOOTBALL: Northern scores game-winning TD to lead Jeffersonville past New Albany
text:
by Kevin Harris 
NEW ALBANY — Jeffersonville quarterback Cam Northern had his John Elway Moment Friday night at Buerk Field, and it advanced the Red Devils into the Class 6A Sectional 8 championship game. 
In doing his best impersonation of the Denver Broncos’ legendary quarterback, Northern marched Jeff on a 99-yard scoring drive than ended with the junior scoring a game-winning 9-yard touchdown tun to defeat archrival New Albany 35-34 in the Sectional 8 semifinals. 
“It’s a credit to these kids. These kids wanted it. They earned it, they played their tails off and they won by one,” Jeff head coach Alfonzo Browning said. 
The Red Devils (6-4) will travel to Class 6A No. 1 Center Grove for next Friday’s Sectional 8 title game. The Trojans won at Columbus North 34-7 in Friday’s other semifinal. 
Jeff received some inspiration from a dramatic goal-line stand by its defense with less than five minutes remaining in regulation. 
On third-and-goal at the Red Devil 11-yard line with New Albany leading 34-28, Bulldog sophomore Rondale Moore appeared to get the ball inside the left pylon of the end zone on a sweep, which would have put New Albany up 12 points. But the officials ruled that Moore did not break the plane of the end zone, setting up a fourth-and-goal inside the Jeff 1. 
Bulldog head coach Sean Coultis disagreed with the call, believing that Moore scored. 
“You don’t want to say the game came down to one play, but geez,” Coultis said. “We’re up by a touchdown with [five] minutes to go and Rondale Moore stays inbounds and hits the pylon with the ball and it’s a touchdown. I don’t want to stay that we got cheated, but geez. That’s a tough call and a tough play. I don’t sit there and blame it on that, but if we score on that, we win the game — I guarantee it. I know Rondale scored. I know he hit that pylon.” 
Bulldog running back Darquan Richardson tried to go up the middle for a score, but the Red Devil defense stopped in short of the goal line. 
With the ball still at the Red Devil 1, Northern and the Jeff offense used 12 plays to move the ball 92 yards to the its own 9. On second-and-5, Northern looked for an open receiver in the pocket, but was unsuccessful. He then tucked the ball under his arm and ran left. 
While carrying multiple New Albany tacklers on his back and a couple friendly pushes by his teammates, Northern got into the end zone with 33 seconds left to put Jeff up one point. 
“I got my teammates pushing me in. Everybody was pulling and yanking, but we got in there. We won the game and that’s all that matters,” Northern said. “Our team has come from behind all year. We’re resilient. Coach has told us that all year that we’ve got to stay resilient, no matter the situation. We’ve been down multiple times, and we’ve always tried to find a way to come back and never give up.” 
The Bulldogs tried to mount a game-winning drive of their own. But on third-and-2 at the Jeff 49, New Albany freshman quarterback Dylan Clark had a deep pass intended to wide receiver Davin Alexander intercepted with four ticks remaining. 
At halftime, Browning expressed his displeasure to his players on their first-half performance. But he was very proud with how the Red Devils fought hard in the second half. 
“Yes, I was frustrated and I laid into them and let them know,” Browning said. “I told them what needed to be done and they responded. It’s a credit to these kids from Jeff High.” 
The Bulldogs started the game with a 14-play, 79-yard drive that chewed up the first 7 minutes and 24 seconds of the contest. 
On fourth down with the ball at one-half yard line, Richardson ran the ball into the end zone to put New Albany up 6-0. Sophomore place-kicker Matheo Urrego-Gutierrez missed the extra point to keep the Bulldogs up six. 
The Red Devils fired back with a quick four-play scoring drive to put them 7-6. Jeff running back Jordan Barnett made a first-down run for 25 yards to get the ball in Bulldog territory. Barnett got the ball on the next play and raced 35 yards for a score with 3:56 remaining in the first quarter. 
New Albany got the lead back a little more than a minute later. Clark found Moore on a 7-yard TD pass to give the Bulldogs a 13-7. 
Jeff then fumbled the ensuing kickoff as New Albany recovered the ball at the Red Devil 33. Three plays later, Richardson produced a 23-yard touchdown run with 1:50 left to extend the Bulldogs’ lead to 20-7. 
The Red Devils pulled to within six again with 19 seconds left in the opening quarter on Barnett’s 2-yard TD run. 
At the 5:12 mark of the second quarter, Moore had a 12-yard touchdown scamper on a sweep to increase New Albany’s advantage to 27-14. It capped off a 46-yard drive where the Bulldogs took advantage of the Red Devils’ second fumble on the first half as Northern failed to catch a snap in the shotgun formation. 
Jeff began the third quarter with an 11-play, 65-yard series that ended with Barnett making a 4-yard TD run to slice the Red Devils’ deficit to 27-21 with 7:31 left in the period. 
The Bulldogs responded with another long scoring drive. Richardson concluded a nine-play, 72-yard possession when he had a 9-yard TD run at the 2:48 mark of the third to put New Albany back up two scores at 34-21. 
But the Red Devils quickly got back to within six when Barnett had his fourth touchdown run of the night from 10 yards out with 1:19 remaining in the third to trim the Bulldog lead to 34-28. 
Despite the setback, New Albany still leads the all-time series, 49-38-5. The Red Devils are 6-3 versus the Bulldogs in postseason games. 
“I hope this loss hurts,” Coultis said. “I hope these kids come out in the offseason and work that much harder to never feel this way again.” 
CLASS 6A SECTIONAL 8 
JEFFERSONVILLE 35, NEW ALBANY 34 
Jeffersonville 14 0 14 7—35 
New Albany 20 7 7 0—34 
SCORING SUMMARY 
N — Darquan Richardson 1 run (kick failed), 4:36. 
J — Jordan Barnett 35 run (Jordan Khan kick), 3:56. 
N — Rondale Moore 7 pass from Dylan Clark (Matheo Urrego-Gutierrez kick), 2:48. 
N — Richardson 23 run (Urrego-Gutierrez kick), 1:50. 
J — Barnett 2 run (Khan kick), :19. 
Second quarter 
N — Moore 12 run (Urrego-Gutierrez kick), 5:12. 
Third quarter 
J — Barnett 4 run (Khan kick), 7:31. 
N — Richardson 9 run (Urrego-Gutierrez kick), 2:48. 
J — Barnett 10 run (Khan kick), 1:19. 
Fourth quarter 
J — Cam Northern 9 run (Khan kick), :33.
